Function: The FAIM2 gene, located within the ch12q13 obesity locus, contains the rs7132908 variant, which has been validated as a causal obesity variant. This variant affects disease susceptibility through cis-regulation, impacting FAIM2 expression and influencing neurodevelopment and cell survival during differentiation into hypothalamic neurons.
Citation: Littleton, S. H., Trang, K. B., Volpe, C. M., Cook, K., DeBruyne, N., Ann Maguire, J., Ann Weidekamp, M., Boehm, K., Chesi, A., Pippin, J. A., Anderson, S. A., Wells, A. D., Pahl, M. C., & Grant, S. F. A. (2023). Variant-to-function analysis of the childhood obesity chr12q13 locus implicates rs7132908 as a causal variant within the 3' UTR of FAIM2. bioRxiv : the preprint server for biology, 2023.08.21.553157. https://doi.org/10.1101/2023.08.21.553157

Function: Filaggrin gene defects increase the risk of allergic sensitisation, atopic eczema, allergic rhinitis, and asthma, particularly in individuals with atopic eczema. Restoring skin barrier function in individuals with filaggrin deficiencies may help prevent the development and progression of allergic disease.
Citation: van den Oord, R. A., & Sheikh, A. (2009). Filaggrin gene defects and risk of developing allergic sensitisation and allergic disorders: systematic review and meta-analysis. BMJ (Clinical research ed.), 339, b2433. https://doi.org/10.1136/bmj.b2433

Function: The IFIH1 gene codes for MDA5, a sensor detecting viral RNA. Variants in IFIH1 impair MDA5 function, leading to compromised viral sensing in the gut and contributing to Very Early Onset Inflammatory Bowel Disease (VEOIBD).
Citation: Cananzi, M., Wohler, E., Marzollo, A., Colavito, D., You, J., Jing, H., Bresolin, S., Gaio, P., Martin, R., Mescoli, C., Bade, S., Posey, J. E., Dalle Carbonare, M., Tung, W., Jhangiani, S. N., Bosa, L., Zhang, Y., Filho, J. S., Gabelli, M., Kellermayer, R., ? Guerrerio, A. L. (2021). IFIH1 loss-of-function variants contribute to very early-onset inflammatory bowel disease. Human genetics, 140(9), 1299?1312. https://doi.org/10.1007/s00439-021-02300-4

Function: IFIH1 gene encodes a protein involved in the innate immune response by sensing viral RNA. Variants in IFIH1 are associated with type 1 diabetes susceptibility, impacting autoimmune processes and beta-cell fragility.
Citation: Shapiro, M. R., Thirawatananond, P., Peters, L., Sharp, R. C., Ogundare, S., Posgai, A. L., Perry, D. J., & Brusko, T. M. (2021). De-coding genetic risk variants in type 1 diabetes. Immunology and cell biology, 99(5), 496?508. https://doi.org/10.1111/imcb.12438

Function: The IFIH1 gene encodes for MDA5, a sensor responsible for detecting viral nucleic acids. In this study, upregulation of IFIH1 was identified as a hub gene associated with nut allergy. This suggests a potential role for MDA5-mediated immune responses, particularly type 1 interferon signaling, in the pathogenesis of nut allergy.
Citation: Lee, K. H., Bosco, A., O'Sullivan, M., Song, Y., Metcalfe, J., Yu, K., Mullins, B. J., Loh, R., & Zhang, G. (2022). Identifying gene network patterns and associated cellular immune responses in children with or without nut allergy. The World Allergy Organization journal, 15(2), 100631. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.waojou.2022.100631
